metadata.title: CVE-2024-38539 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:RDMA/cma: Fix kmemleak in rdma_core observed during blktests nvme/rdma usesiw When running blktests nvme/rdma, the following kmemleak issue willappear. kmemleak: Kernel memory leak detector initialized (mempoolavailable:36041) kmemleak: Automatic memory scanning thread startedkmemleak: 2 new suspected memory leaks (see /sys/kernel/debug/kmemleak)kmemleak: 8 new suspected memory leaks (see /sys/kernel/debug/kmemleak)kmemleak: 17 new suspected memory leaks (see /sys/kernel/debug/kmemleak)kmemleak: 4 new suspected memory leaks (see /sys/kernel/debug/kmemleak)unreferenced object 0xffff88855da53400 (size 192): comm "rdma", pid 10630,jiffies 4296575922 hex dump (first 32 bytes): 37 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 c0 ffff ff 1f 00 00 00 7............... 10 34 a5 5d 85 88 ff ff 10 34 a5 5d 8588 ff ff .4.].....4.].... backtrace (crc 47f66721): [<ffffffff911251bd>]kmalloc_trace+0x30d/0x3b0 [<ffffffffc2640ff7>] alloc_gid_entry+0x47/0x380[ib_core] [<ffffffffc2642206>] add_modify_gid+0x166/0x930 [ib_core][<ffffffffc2643468>] ib_cache_update.part.0+0x6d8/0x910 [ib_core][<ffffffffc2644e1a>] ib_cache_setup_one+0x24a/0x350 [ib_core][<ffffffffc263949e>] ib_register_device+0x9e/0x3a0 [ib_core][<ffffffffc2a3d389>] 0xffffffffc2a3d389 [<ffffffffc2688cd8>]nldev_newlink+0x2b8/0x520 [ib_core] [<ffffffffc2645fe3>]rdma_nl_rcv_msg+0x2c3/0x520 [ib_core] [<ffffffffc264648c>]rdma_nl_rcv_skb.constprop.0.isra.0+0x23c/0x3a0 [ib_core][<ffffffff9270e7b5>] netlink_unicast+0x445/0x710 [<ffffffff9270f1f1>]netlink_sendmsg+0x761/0xc40 [<ffffffff9249db29>] __sys_sendto+0x3a9/0x420[<ffffffff9249dc8c>] __x64_sys_sendto+0xdc/0x1b0 [<ffffffff92db0ad3>]do_syscall_64+0x93/0x180 [<ffffffff92e00126>]entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x71/0x79 The root cause: rdma_put_gid_attris not called when sgid_attr is set to ERR_PTR(-ENODEV).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38539` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
